abstract: Malaysian government declares that disappearance of Malaysia Air Flight 370 in March 2014 was an accident under terms of international agreement and that all 239 passengers and crew members are officially presumed dead; move clears way for death certificates to be issued and for family members to be compensated.
lead_paragraph: The decision cleared the way for relatives of the 239 passengers and crew members who disappeared to receive compensation, but did nothing to clear up what happened to the plane.

byline.contributor: Chris Buckley contributed reporting from Hong Kong, Nicola Clark from Paris, and Michelle Innis from Sydney, Australia.

snippet: The decision cleared the way for relatives of the 239 passengers and crew members who disappeared to receive compensation, but did nothing to clear up what happened to the plane.

headline.main: Loss of Malaysia Airlines Flight 370 Is Declared an Accident
headline.print_headline: Malaysia Declares Loss of Flight 370 in Indian Ocean an Accident
